Package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.service

Class TableImpl

java.lang.Object
io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.BaseComponent
io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.service.TableImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Table
public abstract class TableImpl extends BaseComponent implements Table
Base implementation of the Table interface, providing core functionalities for reading, filtering, sorting, and inserting values into table elements in the UI.

This class defines an abstraction over table interactions and supports table-specific operations such as row retrieval, cell value insertion, and custom filtering.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the row representation.

      start - The starting row index (inclusive).
      end - The ending row index (exclusive).
      clazz - The class type representing the table rows.
      Returns:
      A list of objects representing the selected rows.

    • readTable

      @SafeVarargs public final <T> List<T> readTable(int start, int end, Class<T> clazz, TableField<T>... fields)
      Reads a specific range of rows from the table with only the specified fields.

      This method allows extracting a subset of rows from the table between the given indices, and retrieves only the specified fields from each row.

      Specified by:
      readTable in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the row representation.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting row index (inclusive, 1-based index).
      end - The ending row index (exclusive, 1-based index).
      clazz - The class type representing the table rows.
      fields - The fields to be extracted from the table. If not provided, all fields are retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of objects representing the selected rows with chosen fields.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the start or end indices are invalid.

    • readRow

      public final <T> T readRow(int row, Class<T> clazz)
      Reads a single row from the table based on the row index.

      Type Parameters:

      clazz - The class type representing the table row.
      Returns:

    • readRow

      public final <T> T readRow(List<String> searchCriteria, Class<T> clazz)
      Reads a row that matches the provided search criteria.
      Specified by:
      readRow in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the row representation.
      Parameters:
      searchCriteria - A list of values to match in the row.
      clazz - The class type representing the table row.
      Returns:
      The first matching row.

    • readRow

      @SafeVarargs public final <T> T readRow(int row, Class<T> clazz, TableField<T>... fields)
      Reads a specific row from the table, retrieving only the specified fields.

      This method fetches a single row from the table based on its index (1-based), and extracts only the specified fields if provided. If no fields are provided, all fields of the row are retrieved.

      Specified by:
      readRow in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type representing the table row.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index to be read (1-based index).
      clazz - The class type representing the table row structure.
      fields - The specific fields to be extracted from the row. If not provided, all fields are retrieved.
      Returns:
      An object representing the row with the selected fields.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row index is out of range.

    • readRow

      @SafeVarargs public final <T> T readRow(List<String> searchCriteria, Class<T> clazz, TableField<T>... fields)
      Reads a row from the table that matches the provided search criteria, retrieving only specified fields.

      This method searches for a row in the table that contains all the specified search criteria. It then extracts only the specified fields if provided. If no fields are provided, all fields of the row are retrieved.

      Specified by:
      readRow in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type representing the table row.
      Parameters:
      searchCriteria - A list of strings representing the criteria that must be matched within the row.
      clazz - The class type representing the table row structure.
      fields - The specific fields to be extracted from the matched row.
      Returns:
      An object representing the matching row with the selected fields.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.NotFoundException - if no row matches the search criteria.

    • insertCellValue

      public final <T> void insertCellValue(List<String> searchCriteria, Class<T> rowClass, TableField<T> field, int cellIndex, String... values)
      Inserts a value into a specific cell in the table row that matches the given search criteria.

      This method locates a row in the table based on the provided search criteria and inserts the specified values into a particular field in that row.

      Specified by:
      insertCellValue in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type representing the table row.
      Parameters:
      searchCriteria - A list of strings used to identify the target row.
      rowClass - The class type representing the table row structure.
      field - The specific field within the row where the value should be inserted.
      cellIndex - The index of the cell (1-based) where the value should be inserted.
      values - The values to be inserted into the specified cell.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.NotFoundException - if no row matches the search criteria.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the cell index is out of range.

    • insertCellValue

      public final <T> void insertCellValue(int row, Class<T> rowClass, TableField<T> field, int cellIndex, String... values)
      Inserts a value into a specific cell within a row.
      Specified by:
      insertCellValue in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the row representation.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (1-based index).
      rowClass - The class type representing the table row.
      field - The table field to insert the value into.
      cellIndex - The index of the cell in the row (1-based index).
      values - The values to be inserted.

    • insertCellValue

      public final <T> void insertCellValue(List<String> searchCriteria, Class<T> clazz, T data)
      Inserts values into multiple cells in the table row that matches the given search criteria.

      This method locates a row in the table based on the provided search criteria and inserts values into multiple fields of that row by iterating over the fields of the provided data object.

      Specified by:
      insertCellValue in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type representing the table row.
      Parameters:
      searchCriteria - A list of strings used to identify the target row.
      clazz - The class type representing the table row structure.
      data - The object containing the values to be inserted into the corresponding row fields.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.NotFoundException - if no row matches the search criteria.

    • insertCellValue

      public final <T> void insertCellValue(List<String> searchCriteria, Class<T> clazz, TableField<T> field, String... values)
      Inserts values into a specific cell in the table row that matches the given search criteria.

      This method finds a row in the table based on the provided search criteria and inserts values into the specified field of that row.

      Specified by:
      insertCellValue in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type representing the table row.
      Parameters:
      searchCriteria - A list of strings used to identify the target row.
      clazz - The class type representing the table row structure.
      field - The specific field within the row where the values should be inserted.
      values - The values to be inserted into the specified field.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.NotFoundException - if no row matches the search criteria.

    • insertCellValue

      public final <T> void insertCellValue(int row, Class<T> clazz, TableField<T> field, String... values)
      Inserts values into a specific cell in the table row at the given row index.

      This method finds the row in the table based on the provided row index (1-based) and inserts values into the specified field of that row.

      Specified by:
      insertCellValue in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type representing the table row.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the values should be inserted (1-based index).
      clazz - The class type representing the table row structure.
      field - The specific field within the row where the values should be inserted.
      values - The values to be inserted into the specified field.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row index is out of range.

    • insertCellValue

      public final <T> void insertCellValue(int row, Class<T> clazz, T data)
      Inserts values into multiple cells in the table row at the given row index.

      This method finds the row in the table based on the provided row index (1-based) and inserts values into multiple fields of that row by iterating over the fields of the provided data object.

      Specified by:
      insertCellValue in interface Table
      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:

      data - The object containing the values to be inserted into the corresponding row fields.
      Throws:

    • filterTable

      public final <T> void filterTable(Class<T> tclass, TableField<T> column, FilterStrategy filterStrategy, String... values)
      Filters a table column based on a specified filtering strategy.
      Specified by:
      filterTable in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the row representation.
      Parameters:
      tclass - The class type representing the table row.
      column - The table field representing the column to be filtered.
      filterStrategy - The filtering strategy to be applied.
      values - The values used for filtering.

    • sortTable

      public final <T> void sortTable(Class<T> tclass, TableField<T> column, SortingStrategy sortingStrategy)
      Sorts a table column based on a specified sorting strategy.
      Specified by:
      sortTable in interface Table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the row representation.
      Parameters:
      tclass - The class type representing the table row.
      column - The table field representing the column to be sorted.
      sortingStrategy - The sorting strategy to be applied.

    • sortTable

      protected void sortTable(SmartWebElement headerCell, SortingStrategy sortingStrategy)
      Sorts the table based on the given header cell and sorting strategy.

      This method provides an extension point for subclasses to define how sorting is applied to a table. It can be overridden to implement specific sorting logic.

      Parameters:
      headerCell - The SmartWebElement representing the header cell to be clicked for sorting.
      sortingStrategy - The SortingStrategy defining the sorting direction (e.g., ascending or descending).

    • getTableContainer

      protected SmartWebElement getTableContainer(org.openqa.selenium.By tableContainerLocator)
      Retrieves the table container element using the specified locator.

      This method is protected to allow subclasses to modify or override the way the table container is located. It ensures that the SmartWebElement representing the table container is retrieved correctly.

      Parameters:
      tableContainerLocator - The locator used to find the table container.
      Returns:
      A SmartWebElement representing the table container.

    • getRows

      protected List<SmartWebElement> getRows(SmartWebElement tableContainer, org.openqa.selenium.By tableRowsLocator, String section)
      Retrieves all rows from the specified table container.

      This method waits until all rows are visible before retrieving them. It can be overridden by subclasses to customize how table rows are retrieved.

      Parameters:
      tableContainer - The SmartWebElement representing the table container.
      tableRowsLocator - The locator used to find the table rows.
      section - The table section from which rows should be retrieved (optional).
      Returns:
      A list of SmartWebElement representing the table rows.

    • getHeaderRow

      protected SmartWebElement getHeaderRow(SmartWebElement tableContainer, org.openqa.selenium.By headerRowLocator, String tableSection)
      Retrieves the header row of a table.

      This method locates and returns the header row within the given table container. It can be overridden by subclasses to implement custom header retrieval logic.

      Parameters:
      tableContainer - The SmartWebElement representing the table container.
      headerRowLocator - The locator used to find the header row.
      tableSection - The section of the table where the header row is located (optional).
      Returns:
      A SmartWebElement representing the header row.
